profile.name: profile
profile.description: Provides the ASK CLI profile to use. When you don't include this option, ASK CLI uses the default profile.

debug.name: debug
debug.description: Enables the ASK CLI  to show debug messages in the output of the command.

full-response.name: full-response
full-response.description: Returns body, headers and status code of the response as one object.

ignore-hash.name: ignore-hash
ignore-hash.description: Forces the ASK CLI deploy skill package even if the hash of current skill package folder does not change.

target.name: target
target.description:
Specify which skill project resource to deploy.
[ENUM]: skill-metadata,skill-infrastructure

no-browser.name: no-browser
no-browser.description: ASK CLI displays a URL that you can use to sign in with your Amazon developer account from anywhere

replay.name: replay
replay.description: Specify a replay file to simulate dialog with Alexa

save-skill-io.name: save-skill-io
save-skill-io.description: Specify an output file to write simulation invocation requests and responses.

hosted-skill-id.name: hosted-skill-id
hosted-skill-id.description: skill-id for the Alexa hosted skill

templateUrl.name: template-url
templateUrl.description: Url for the template to be used with

templateBranch.name: template-branch
templateBranch.description: Git branch used with the template url

file.name: file
file.description: Path to the target file input

max-results.name: max-results
max-results.description: Max results returned by the request

next-token.name: next-token
next-token.description: Next token if the result is paginated

etag.name: etag
etag.description: The eTag from the resource's last update

scopes.name: scopes
scopes.description: Request with particular scope(s) from Login with Amazon, delimited by space

client-confirmation.name: client-confirmation
client-confirmation.description: The client-secret when registering LWA application, uses CLI's default if not set

client-id.name: client-id
client-id.description: The client-id when registering LWA application, uses CLI's default if not set

task-version.name: task-version
task-version.description: Version of a task. For example: 1, 2, 3 and so on.

provider-skill-id.name: provider-skill-id
provider-skill-id.description: Task provider skill id. When this is specified, we will only fetch the tasks from this given skill ID.

keywords.name: keywords
keywords.description:
Keywords can be description of tasks, task name or tags in task definition.
[MULTIPLE]: Values can be separated by comma.
